page.title: 13The Shaftesbury Society
page.content: Trueloves, the residential home for slightly mentally handicapped adults, is a branch of the Shaftesbury Society. 1985 is a special year for the Society, for it is 100 years since the death of the first President, Lord Shaftesbury, Anthony Ashley Cooper. The Society was started in 1844 as the Ragged School Union to care for needy, young people. Lord Shaftesbury was a great social reformer in Queen Victoria's reign and was known as the 'Children's Earl'. Many thousands of children were saved from long and painful hours in factories, coal mines and chimneys. Trueloves is only one of the many places the Society runs. There are Mission Centres, Further Education Centres for the disabled, Residential Schools for physically handicapped children and a Housing Association.
